intro: Paradrymonia lurida, commonly known as the pale paradrymonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, pale pink to white flowers and heart-shaped leaves. It typically grows in wetlands and along stream banks, thriving in moist, sandy soils. Paradrymonia lurida is often found in swampy habitats and is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
